doc.name: email-no-job
doc.synopsis: How to email a submitted form
doc.description:
WSForm can send a submitted form as an email. The WSForm tag needs an action of 'email' for this. All other setting are done through the wsemail function.


to, cc, bcc, from fields need to be all valid email addresses
As of version 0.8.0.3.7
These fields can be simple email addresses or use the following format to include names : Wikibase Solutions [info@wikibase.nl]
These fields can be comma separated to include more addressees.


Subject is the subject of the email

html is by default yes. If set to "no" mail will be send as plain text

footer and header are title names of wiki pages that will be added to the email body.

attachment (as of v0.8.0.3.5) is used to add a file with the email. Currently only supports 1 file. Example : {{filepath:IMG_8676.jpg}}

Use a template if you have a form with filled in fields that need to be added to the body of the email.

A template is the title of a wiki page where the body of your email is written. The names of the form fields should be in this template with a suffix of '$'. So, if your form has a input field with the name "name", your template should have the word "$name" in it. This will be replaced by the value submitted by the form. ATTN: If no value is found, your email body will contain '"$name".


So basically there are 3 ways to send emails with WSForm:

  1. Have all the email details inside the form and the content between the start and end brackets of wsemail. (No form fields will be send with the email)
  2. Have all the email details inside the form, but have a template with the body of an email where form fields will be placed into.
  3. Create a job (a json page inside the wiki) where every job is completely defined.

New in v0.7.0.3.6

Create a form with only a template assigned to wsemail. This will function as step 2 (see above), but the template can also hold all the additional information for the email to be send.

The following command can be added to the template (and will be removed before sending) to, from, subject, cc, bcc, header, footer.
These are written in a special format : Starting with %ws_  and ending with %. For example : %ws_to=me@email.com% or %ws_subject=test subject%

If the wsemail parameter also has to, from, subject etc.. they will overrule the template ones.

New in v0.8.0.3.8
Use the WSForm message on success attribute to specify a success message when email sending is done.
doc.example:
Testmail versie 0.1 WSForm emailing

 Example for a template : Dear $name, This is an automated email message based on a template. Your streetname is : $street Number of your house : $number You city is : $city Regards, WSForm
doc.note: Remember.. when using this solution (not using a job), people can inspect the source of a page and discover all the details of the email.
